metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5369 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Enigmail 1.7.x before 1.7.2 sends emails in plaintext when encryption is enabled and only BCC recipients are specified, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information by sniffing the network.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5369` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

enigmail - 2:1.7.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: enigmail package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.7.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
